definition: to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
householder who refuses to vacate his home despite pressure from property developers
lit. a soft nail/fig. a tactful retort or rejection

sentences.english: Then the nail must be straightened before it can be hammered into place correctly.
sentences.chinese: 于是在把钉子正确地钉入之前，需要先弄直它。

sentences.english: Shape the nail, using a file or emery board .
sentences.chinese: 塑造钉子，使用一个文件或金刚砂董事会。

sentences.english: Can you knock the nail into the wall?
sentences.chinese: 你能把这个钉子敲进墙壁里去吗？

sentences.english: You will have to fasten the lid down with nails .
sentences.chinese: 你必须用钉子把盖子钉牢。

sentences.english: Use the battens of two by one inches and steel nails for nailing to the wall.
sentences.chinese: 由一个使用条板二移动和钉牢的钢钉子对墙壁。

sentences.english: Her skirt got caught on a nail.
sentences.chinese: 她的裙边给钉子钩住了。

sentences.english: He gripped the nail and pulled it out.
sentences.chinese: 他钳住钉子，把它拔了出来。

sentences.english: So I took a deep breath and worked on the last nail.
sentences.chinese: 我深深地吸了口气，去拔最后一根钉子。

sentences.english: You have to use strength and skill to pound these long nails in.
sentences.chinese: 要敲进这些长钉子，你既得有力气，又得有技巧。

sentences.english: He ran a nail into the wall to hang his painting.
sentences.chinese: 他在墙上钉了一个钉子挂上他的绘画。

sentences.english: Next push 46 of the small nails into the bottom row of holes.
sentences.chinese: 下推46的小钉子钉入下面一行是孔的网。

sentences.english: The edge of her skirt caught on a nail.
sentences.chinese: 她的裙边给钉子钩住了。

sentences.english: He taped a nail in slowly to spilt the thin board.
sentences.chinese: 他慢慢地把钉子钉进这块簿板，以防劈开。

sentences.english: Fill in nail holes in drywall with  toothpaste and baking soda.
sentences.chinese: 牙膏与小苏打混合可以用来填补墙面的钉子洞。

sentences.english: The nail perforated her coat and left an ugly rip.
sentences.chinese: 钉子穿透她的上衣，留下一块难看的破绽。

sentences.english: It's no easy to pound a nail into a hard board.
sentences.chinese: 把钉子敲进硬木板不容易。

definition: to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
nut (female component of nut and bolt)
to go all out/to rise to
